text:
Interesting — what would you want to put into that tab?

You’re right, it’s not supported. This is the first I’ve hearing of anyone wanting to customize it (~granted, it’s relatively new~ actually, not that new :slightly_smiling_face:). I’d love to hear more about what you’re looking to do.
It’s not possible to add a class like you describe without going into the source, but I wonder if a custom module could give you the flexibility you’re looking for?

See the note in yellow at the top of this article: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/modules/getting-started>
It sounds like you may be able to create a field which your content team members could input a class into and pull in the styling they want.

At the moment users are able to customise the styles of HubSpot core modules via that tab . The introduction of “themes” is great, but as far as I understand (and i could be completely wrong here) you cannot access those variables from a module. I imagine in some custom modules people are using fields.json to add fields which are more related to the the design of a look and feel of the module.
Not sure I follow - are you looking to customize the design of one particular module while using a Theme? And make that option available to a non-developer?

Sorry didnt explain that well. I read in the <#CSFGKSHT7|themes> that if i setup a themes.json and a fields.json at the top level of a theme those variables will be accessable in JS files, CSS files and template files. However, I don’t think that includes CSS/JS and templates inside modules, does it?

If that is true, currently the only option at the moment to allow users to tweak the look and feel of a custom module is to add it as a field in fields.json for the custom module. This is fine, and it works, and I imagine many people are doing this. However, would it not be cleaner to allow developers to specify if a field in a custom module is a “style” or data field?

Maybe a custom “slider” module as an example:

• Repeater field for “slides”
• Autoplay speed
• Show arrows (bool)
• Show dots (bool)
• Transition type
• Overlay
Some of these fields are data, and others effect the “styles”, so I feel it would be nice to allow us to drop them in the styles tab.
A custom module would work but I want to be able to put it inside a rich text field or more specifically a blog post
Hey Tim, we should talk! We might have something cooking that will help with this…. DM-ing you.
